trans-unit.source: Represents a key identifier.
Typically, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier> is not used, other than when a custom security token service is created.
When a security token service returns a security token, the issued security token contains references to attached and unattached security tokens.

Attached references refer to security tokens that are contained within the security header of a SOAP message and unattached references are security tokens that are not included within the security header of a SOAP message.
These references typically affirm the authenticity of the issued security token.
These references are represented by classes that derive from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause> class.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier> class contains the collection of these references.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier"></xref> class using the specified key identifier clauses.
identifiers is `null`.
Adds a key identifier clause to the end of the list.
item is `null`.
The value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.IsReadOnly"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets a value that indicates whether a key can be created for at least one of the key identifier clauses.
`true` if a key can be created for at least one of the key identifier clauses; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of key identifier clauses.
The number of key identifier clauses.
Creates a key for one of the key identifier clauses.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey> that is returned is for the first key identifier clause in the collection that can create a key.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that represents the created key.
A key could not be created for any of the key identifier clauses.
Searches for a key identifier clause of the specified type and returns the first occurrence within the entire collection.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that represents the type of key identifier clause to search the collection for.
The first in the collection that is of the type specified in the TClause parameter.
TClause is `null`.
The collection does not contain a key identifier clause of the type specified in the TClause parameter.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection of key identifier clauses.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.List`1.Enumerator"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> for the collection.
Gets a value that indicates whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets the key identifier clause at the specified index.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> at the specified index.
i is less than 0.
-or-
i is equal to or greater than .
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
For example, a key identifier clause cannot be added to this object.
Returns the current object.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifier.ToString%2A> method returns the details of all of the key identifier clauses in the key identifier.
The current object.
Searches for a key identifier clause of the specified type and returns a value that indicates whether a clause of that type could be found.
When a type is found it is returned in the `out` parameter.
When a key identifier clause of the type specified in the `TClause` parameter does not exist in the collection, the `clause` out parameter is `null`.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKeyIdentifierClause"></xref> that represents the type of key identifier clause to search the collection for.
`true` when a key identifier clause of the type specified in the TClause parameter exists in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection of key identifier clauses.
A <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1"></xref> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
